clinical_study.brief_title: A Modified Approach for the Closure of Oral Sinus Communications
clinical_study.official_title: A Modified Approach for the Closure of Oral Sinus Communications

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to describe a modified surgical approach for the closure of oral sinus communications, using a buccal trapezoidal flap combined with a connective pedicle flap rotated from the palate

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: case series of a new surgical design

secondary_outcome.description: These parameters are described using VAS technique

arm_group.arm_group_label: modified buccal flap and subepithelial connective palatal flap

intervention.intervention_name: modified buccal flap and subepithelial connective palatal flap
intervention.description: The connective flap was harvested from the deeper area of the palatal mucosa. Pedicle flap dimensions were reported using the periodontal probe. The flap was then rotated to cover the oro antral communication (OAC) area. The rotation could be in mesial or distal direction, related to OAC position and for the convenience of the donor site. The connective palatal flap was sutured to the buccal periostium using mattress sutures.
intervention.arm_group_label: modified buccal flap and subepithelial connective palatal flap
